intro: Phlox divergens, commonly known as the showy phlox, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped, dark green leaves, and it is often used in gardens for its ornamental value. Phlox divergens is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
